pageContext.claim: “He [Biden] was not talking about his acuity test. You know it's called cognitive and he didn't get the word. But he was really referring to something else because somebody was screaming. And one of the few questions that sounded real was that question. He said, ‘I -- I get tested all the time.’ But he was talking -- I assume he was talking about the COVID not -- not cognitive and now he's mixed up.”
pageContext.analysis: Biden was asked whether he had taken a cognitive test. He responded that he gets tested regularly for the novel coronavirus, and then added: "Look, all you've got to do is watch me, and I can hardly wait to compare my cognitive capability to the cognitive capability of the man I'm running against." The White House refused to release the results of an alleged cognitive test taken by Trump. In 2018, Trump passed a cognitive test known as the Montreal Cognitive Assessment, which tests for “mild cognitive dysfunction" It's a 10-minute test and patients are asked to draw a clock, animals and other objects. Patients can receive up to 30 points. Any score 26 and above is considered normal. Anything lower indicates dementia.Trump scored a 30, but so would most people.
